com.google.android.agera

Class Observables

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.agera.Observables

  • public final class Observables
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for obtaining Observable instances.

    Any Observable created by this class have to be created from a Looper thread or they will throw an IllegalStateException

    UpdateDispatchers created by this class will for any injected ActivationHandler call ActivationHandler.observableActivated(UpdateDispatcher) and ActivationHandler.observableDeactivated(UpdateDispatcher) on the thread the UpdateDispatcher was created on.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Observable compositeObservable(Observable... observables)
      Returns an Observable that notifies added Updatables that any of the observables have changed.
      static Observable conditionalObservable(Condition condition, Observable... observables)
      Returns an Observable that notifies added Updatables that any of the observables have changed only if the condition applies.
      static Observable perLoopObservable(Observable... observables)
      Returns an Observable that notifies added Updatables that the observable has changed, but never more often than once per Looper cycle.
      static Observable perMillisecondObservable(int shortestUpdateWindowMillis, Observable... observables)
      Returns an Observable that notifies added Updatables that the observables has changed, but never more often than every shortestUpdateWindowMillis.
      static UpdateDispatcher updateDispatcher()
      Returns an asynchronous UpdateDispatcher.
      static UpdateDispatcher updateDispatcher(ActivationHandler activationHandler)
      Returns an asynchronous UpdateDispatcher.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • compositeObservable

        public static Observable compositeObservable(Observable... observables)
        Returns an Observable that notifies added Updatables that any of the observables have changed.

      • conditionalObservable

        public static Observable conditionalObservable(Condition condition,
                                               Observable... observables)
        Returns an Observable that notifies added Updatables that any of the observables have changed only if the condition applies.

      • perMillisecondObservable

        public static Observable perMillisecondObservable(int shortestUpdateWindowMillis,
                                                  Observable... observables)
        Returns an Observable that notifies added Updatables that the observables has changed, but never more often than every shortestUpdateWindowMillis.

      • perLoopObservable

        public static Observable perLoopObservable(Observable... observables)
        Returns an Observable that notifies added Updatables that the observable has changed, but never more often than once per Looper cycle.

      • updateDispatcher

        public static UpdateDispatcher updateDispatcher()
        Returns an asynchronous UpdateDispatcher.

        Updatable.update() can be called from any thread Observable.addUpdatable(Updatable) and Observable.removeUpdatable(Updatable) can only be called from Looper threads. Any added Updatable will be called on the thread they were added from.

      • updateDispatcher

        public static UpdateDispatcher updateDispatcher(ActivationHandler activationHandler)
        Returns an asynchronous UpdateDispatcher.

        See updateDispatcher()

        updatablesChanged will be called on the same thread as the UpdateDispatcher was created from when the first Updatable was added / last Updatable was removed.

        This UpdateDispatcher is useful when implementing Observable services with an active/inactive lifecycle.
